title: How social networks predict epidemics
description: After mapping humans' intricate social networks, Nicholas Christakis and colleague James Fowler began investigating how this information could better our lives. Now, he reveals his hot-off-the-press findings: These networks can be used to detect epidemics earlier than ever, from the spread of innovative ideas to risky behaviors to viruses (like H1N1).
author: Nicholas Christakis
keywords: TED, talks, health, humanity, medicine, meme, science, society, friendship
